title: Yuta Kobayashi joined Kanagawa Philharmonic Orchestra as Associate Conductor
content:
Yuta Kobayashi joined Kanagawa Philharmonic Orchestra as Associate Conductor on 1 October 2022.

See the press release on Kanagawa Philharmonic Orchestra’s  website.

title: About (ja)
excerpt: Yuta Kobayashi is the Associate Conductor of Kanagawa Philharmonic Orchestra.
content:
English Japanese

1997年新潟県長岡市生まれ。

給費奨学生として東京音楽大学指揮科に入学。これまでに指揮を広上淳一、田代俊文、増井信貴ら各氏に師事。鍵盤楽器奏者として別府アルゲリッチ音楽祭、東京音楽大学シンフォニーオーケストラ定期演奏会等に出演。東京音楽大学創立111周年記念演奏会「指揮クラブ フレンドシップコンサート」にて、東京音楽大学特別編成オーケストラを指揮。

大学卒業と同時に、公益財団法人日本製鉄文化財団 2021年度若手指揮者育成支援制度に合格。指揮研究員として、紀尾井ホール室内管弦楽団、読売日本交響楽団、東京フィルハーモニー交響楽団にて研鑽を積み、広上淳一、下野竜也、高関健の各氏に指導を受ける。

これまでに神奈川フィルハーモニー管弦楽団、横浜シンフォニエッタ、東京フィルハーモニー交響楽団、東京混声合唱団等を指揮。オペラの分野では、日本オペラ振興会等のプロダクションに音楽スタッフとして参加。また、テレビ朝日「題名のない音楽会」等のメディアにも出演。2021年4月より2024年3月まで京都市ジュニアオーケストラ副指揮者を務めた。

2022年10月、神奈川フィルハーモニー管弦楽団副指揮者に就任。第20回東京国際指揮者コンクール、第58回ブザンソン国際指揮者コンクール本選などに招待された。

title: About
excerpt: Yuta Kobayashi is the Associate Conductor of Kanagawa Philharmonic Orchestra.
content:
English Japanese

Yuta Kobayashi is a Japanese Conductor.

He was invited to the final rounds of the 58th International Besançon Competition for Young Conductors and the 20th Tokyo International Conducting Competition.

Since the beginning of the 2022-2023 season, He has been the Associate Conductor at the Kanagawa Philharmonic Orchestra.

He gained further experience at the Yomiuri Nippon Orchestra and the Tokyo Philharmonic Orchestra, in the 2021-2022 season as Assistant Conductor of the Kioi Hall Chamber Orchestra and the Kyoto Junior Orchestra (belonging to the City of Kyoto Symphony Orchestra).

He has conducted orchestras such as Kanagawa Philharmonic Orchestra, Tokyo Philharmonic Orchestra, Yokohama Sinfonietta, Orchestre Victor Hugo, and The Philharmonic Chorus of Tokyo.

He performed at the 21st Music Festival Argerich (Beppu — Japan) in 2019 as an orchestra pianist.

Born in Niigata, Japan, Yuta Kobayashi learned piano, percussion, and viola in early childhood. He won the 1st prize at the 3rd wind and percussion competition in Niigata.

He studied conducting at the Tokyo College of Music as a scholarship student and he was taught by professor Junichi Hirokami. He then studied with professors Tatsuya Shimono, Ryusuke Numajiri, and Kazuki Yamada. He participated in conducting master classes with Boris Belkin, Tsugio Tokunaga, and Yasuhiko Shiozawa.
